summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Pretrial Services officer Natasha Ramesar and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the intake and upcoming arraignment of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. The email includes details about Maxwell's charges, her attorneys, and her housing at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing
events.description: Scheduled arraignment and bail hearing for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell arrives in SDNY
events.description: Defendant Ghislaine Maxwell arrives in the Southern District of New York and is expected to be housed at the MDC.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
Maxwell was represented by retained defense attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
Upon arrival in the Southern District of New York, Maxwell was to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a motion for detention, indicating the government sought to hold Maxwell without bail.
